title: [Large-Scale] Behavior-Analytic Computer Language Instruction Design: Intermediate Language Learning Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and elementary-level language comprehension (basic grammar, fundamental vocabulary, simple text reading skills)
context.additional_context: The need to establish adaptive computer-based learning environments and formative assessment systems aligned with individual learning paces, applying multimodal interfaces to enhance integrated speaking, listening, reading, and writing competencies.

learning_goals: Learners complete computer language tasks based on behavior analysis principles with 80% accuracy, analyzing text structures and vocabulary usage patterns.
In the language domain, learners use a computer-based feedback system to perform self-corrections in at least three out of four attempts, improving grammatical errors and expression methods.
Learners analyze formative assessment data to reduce individual learning gaps by 50% within two weeks, enhancing reading comprehension and writing skills.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
